triples.name: Reinforcement learning
triples.relevance: The paper employs reinforcement learning algorithm as the core methodology for designing adaptive fault-tolerant control.

triples.name: Neural network
triples.relevance: Action and critic neural networks are used to approximate control signals and cost functions respectively.

triples.name: Backstepping
triples.relevance: Backstepping technique is combined with reinforcement learning to design direct adaptive optimal controllers.

triples.name: Lyapunov stability
triples.relevance: Lyapunov stability theory is used to prove that all closed-loop system signals are semiglobally uniformly ultimately bounded.

triples.name: Multi-agent system
triples.relevance: The paper addresses control of discrete-time multiagent systems which is the problem domain being solved.

triples.name: Adaptive control
triples.relevance: The paper proposes adaptive fault-tolerant tracking control as a novel contribution combining multiple techniques.
